conclusion: Attempting to figure out which container the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Understanding the setup with four points of liquid flow: A, B, C, and D, each with a corresponding color.
First image shows channels connected to containers E, F, and G.
Second and third images show progression of liquid flow spreading downward.
Trace the path of each flow from A, B, C, and D to see where they end up.
A is a yellow pipe pointing downward in the first image.
Yellow flow from A is branching out and interacting with baffles in the second image.
Yellow flow from A appears directed towards container E in the third image.
Orange pipe from B is diagonal in the first image.
Orange flow from B is branching and seems to be heading towards container F in the second image.
Orange flow from B looks like it's connecting to container F in the third image.
Gray pipe from C is horizontal in the first image.
Gray flow from C is interacting with other flows and seems directed towards container F in the second image.
Gray flow from C appears to be connecting to container F in the third image.
Blue pipe from D is vertical in the first image.
Blue flow from D is spreading out and seems to be heading towards container G in the second image.
Blue flow from D looks like it's connecting to container G in the third image.
Question asks to predict which container liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Observing images suggests each flow is heading towards a different container.
Consider the combined effect of all flows.
